Key Arguments: The legislation exempts certain bodies from penalties for misinformation, which is concerning.
The pharmaceutical industry influences medical education, leading to misinformation about treatments and risks.
Current conflict of interest policies in medical schools are inadequate.
The legislation may protect professional misinformation while targeting individuals trying to expose truths.
There is a need for transparency and truth in medical education and marketing.
Main Themes: Conflict of interest in medical education
Exemption of certain bodies from misinformation penalties
Need for transparency in medical information
Notable Quotes: This is the most concerning part to me, as an Ex Medical Doctor, well aware of the misinformation infiltrating the Medical Curriculum by the Pharmaceutical Industry...
Seems to me instead of addressing potentially Lethal conflict of Interest you are writing Laws making such free from Misinformation Consequences.. May the consequences haunt you.
